item.title: Morocco earthquake: Race against time to save survivors buried in rubble
item.description: Villagers dig by hand to find those still trapped, with few signs of an official response in some areas.

item.title: Luis Rubiales resigns as president of Spanish FA over Jenni Hermoso kiss
item.description: Luis Rubiales resigns as president of the Spanish Football Federation following criticism for kissing Jenni Hermoso after the Women's World Cup final.

item.title: Government faces pressure on China stance after spy claims
item.description: Tory MPs call for China to be branded a threat, amid spy claims following the arrest of a Commons researcher.

item.title: Covid: Care homes and housebound get booster shots in England
item.description: The jabs are being given faster than planned in England, because a new variant is spreading in the UK.

item.title: American Bully XL dogs: Suella Braverman seeks 'urgent advice' on possible ban
item.description: The Home Secretary says the breed is a clear and lethal danger, particularly to children.

item.title: US Open 2023 results: Novak Djokovic wins 24th major by beating Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Novak Djokovic draws level with Australian Margaret Court on 24 major singles titles by outlasting Daniil Medvedev in a punishing US Open final.

item.title: Hospital inspectors probe Nottingham NHS trust over three baby deaths
item.description: The Nottingham University Hospitals trust is already facing a police investigation over the deaths.

item.title: Daniel Khalife charged over Wandsworth prison escape
item.description: The 21-year-old is accused of escaping from the prison while awaiting trial on a terror offence.

item.title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Wales 32-26 Fiji - Warren Gatland's side survive late fightback
item.description: Wales survive a dramatic late Fiji fightback to edge a captivating World Cup opener in Bordeaux.

item.title: Egypt angry as Ethiopia fills Nile dam reservoir amid water row
item.description: Ethiopia's giant hydroelectric dam on the Blue Nile stokes Egyptian fears of dire water shortages.

item.title: Sarah Lancashire says 'terrible menopause' affects her memory
item.description: The actress, 58, says she suffered hot flushes during last week's National Television Awards.

item.title: UK heatwave endures - but storms loom for many
item.description: Temperatures have exceeded 30C for a seventh day, but a thunderstorm warning is issued for many areas.

item.title: Ukraine war: Two foreign aid workers die in Russian missile strike
item.description: Two volunteers are killed and two others injured when their vehicle comes under fire in Ukraine.

item.title: The Papers: 'Hostile act in Parliament' and dog 'terror on streets'
item.description: Many of Mondayâ€™s papers lead on the arrest of a parliamentary researcher, amid claims he was spying for China.

item.title: Luis Rubiales: The kiss that shook Spanish and global football
item.description: It should have been a time of great celebration for Spain but a historic Women's World Cup win has been overshadowed by a sexism scandal.

item.title: Covid booster: Who can get another jab this autumn?
item.description: Covid vaccine rules are changing, but those most at risk will be offered another jab in the autumn.

item.title: US and Vietnam get a friendship upgrade
item.description: The US and Vietnam are becoming better friends - and that's a troubling prospect for China.

item.title: How India overcame bitter G20 divisions over Ukraine
item.description: Consensus seemed far away, but India managed to bring together nations with starkly divergent views.

item.title: How Essex found itself at the heart of the school concrete crisis
item.description: Families in the county which has the highest number of schools affected by Raac share their stories.

item.title: Ruby Franke and 8 passengers: The rise and fall of a parenting influencer
item.description: A woman who shot to fame giving parenting advice has been charged with six counts of child abuse

item.title: Last night of the Proms: Sweltering heat fails to dampen the audience's spirits
item.description: The audience stomp, clap and wave flags of every denomination as the eight-week Proms season ends.

item.title: Inside the high-stakes soap opera that led to political chaos
item.description: Key players tell Laura Kuenssberg how six years of political turbulence rocked the British state.

item.title: Stopping the scammers who target online jobseekers
item.description: Fraudsters are using fake job ads to try to get people to give them money or their personal data.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: Fans' joy as Wales beat Fiji
item.description: Rugby fans are jubilant as Wales secure a win over Fiji in Bordeaux.

item.title: Mobile cinema at risk after 25 years on the road
item.description: Funding problems have threatened the future of the Screen Machine service.

item.title: Inflatable whales used in exercise to simulate mass stranding
item.description: The training tested volunteers' skills on several life-size inflatable models of pilot whales.

item.title: England vs New Zealand: Liam Livingstone stars as hosts level series
item.description: Liam Livingstone's 95 sets up a series-levelling victory for England against New Zealand in Southampton.

item.title: Great British Sewing Bee judge's bid to restart Welsh underwear making
item.description: Did you know the Wonderbra and Agent Provocateur were once made in the south Wales valleys?

item.title: Cleveland Pools: Bath's Georgian lido reopens after 40 years
item.description: The 208-year-old attraction was saved by campaigners who raised millions to restore it.

item.title: Salisbury Cathedral restoration complete after four decades
item.description: Scaffolding around the cathedral will be removed after the completion of decades of renovations.

item.title: Johannesburg fire: Inside a 'hijacked' South African building
item.description: A resident describes her life inside one of South Africa's 'hijacked' buildings.

item.title: Ukraine offensive could have only 30 days left - US Army chief
item.description: Gen Mark Milley tells Laura Kuenssberg the autumn weather will make Ukraine's manoeuvres much harder.

item.title: Antony to delay Manchester United return after assault allegations
item.description: Manchester United's Antony will delay his return to the club after allegations of assault.

item.title: Mo Farah fourth in final race of career
item.description: Britain's four-time Olympic champion Mo Farah brings the curtain down on his illustrious career with a fourth-place finish in the Great North Run.

item.title: Man becomes first amputee to swim North Channel
item.description: Jonty Warneken, who lost his leg in a car crash, swam solo from Northern Ireland to Scotland.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: Nervous Wales fans await 'toughest game'
item.description: Fans in Bordeaux are wary of Fiji's threat, an opponent all too familiar to Wales.

item.title: The surfer preparing for nine seconds of craziness
item.description: Ben Larg, from Tiree, is preparing to take on some of the world's biggest waves this winter.

item.title: In pictures: Finding beauty in rugged sights of the Black Country
item.description: Artist Tom Hicks explores the post-industrial landscape of the Black Country in a new book.

item.title: How often should you wash and change your towel?
item.description: Experts tell us how often you should wash your towel and the risks if you leave it too long.

item.title: Princess Diana's iconic black sheep sweater up for auction
item.description: Misplaced for decades, the garment was rediscovered in an attic earlier this year.

item.title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Finn Russell & Scotland get lost in South African maze
item.description: Scotland rugby fans dreamed of what-might-be against South Africa, but this was a dose of reality served cold, writes Tom English.

item.title: England vs New Zealand: Liam Livingstone shows batting versatility in match-winning knock
item.description: England batter Liam Livingstone reflects on his match-winning 95 not out against New Zealand.

item.title: Matt Dawson column: George Ford had freedom to take control in Owen Farrell absence
item.description: England have sent a reminder to the World Cup's big guns with their performance against Argentina, says Matt Dawson.

item.title: Northern Ireland: Boss Michael O'Neill admits 'process is painful' but 'bigger picture' is vital
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill admits their miserable Euro 2024 qualifying campaign has started to feel like Groundhog Day.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Liam Livingstone helps level ODI series
item.description: Watch highlights as England comfortably beat New Zealand by 79 runs to level the one-day international series in a rain-affected encounter at Southampton.

item.title: Irish Open: Vincent Norrman wins as Rory McIlroy hopes are sunk
item.description: Sweden's Vincent Norrman shoots a closing 65 to win the Irish Open as Rory McIlroy blows his chances by finding water four times.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Deontay Wilder: Terms agreed for heavyweight fight, says promoter Eddie Hearn
item.description: Promoter Eddie Hearn says terms have been agreed for Anthony Joshua to fight Deontay Wilder, but the Briton may walk away if contracts are not agreed soon.

item.title: Morocco earthquake: CCTV footage shows man narrowly avoiding building collapse
item.description: CCTV shows the moment rubble begins to fall from a building onto the street where a man is standing.

item.title: Morocco quake leaves half of village's population dead or missing
item.description: Tafeghaghte was home to 200 people. Ninety are now dead, and the grief of those left behind is palpable.

item.title: Morocco earthquake: British tourists describe 'terrifying' moment quake hit
item.description: Holidaymakers in Marrakesh detail the moment the devastating earthquake hit and their rush to safety.

item.title: Morocco's national football team give blood after quake
item.description: The team's upcoming match against Liberia on Morocco's coastline was cancelled as a result of the earthquake.

item.title: Morocco earthquake: Such magnitude unusual for country
item.description: There has been nothing bigger than a magnitude 6.0 in the affected area for more than 100 years.

item.title: Morocco: Inside remote mountain village devastated by quake
item.description: The BBC's Nick Beake is in Amizmiz where people are searching rubble by hand to find belongings and relatives.

item.title: Morocco: Rubble from partially collapsed Jemaa el-Fnaa mosque fell on car
item.description: The BBC's Anna Holligan is at the site of the Jemaa el-Fnaa mosque looking at the damage.

item.title: Four videos show extent of damage in Marrakesh
item.description: An earthquake in central Morocco has killed hundreds of people with reports some remain trapped under rubble.

item.title: Morocco earthquake: What we know
item.description: A look at what is known about the quake that has claimed the lives of thousands of people.

item.title: In pictures: Historic Marrakesh devastated by quake
item.description: Large areas of the old city in Marrakesh are devastated by Friday evening's powerful quake.

item.title: 'It was total chaos': Voices from the earthquake
item.description: People in Morocco tell of the panic and confusion felt after a powerful earthquake hit late at night.

item.title: Morocco earthquake: Dust surrounds Kutubiyya mosque following deadly quake
item.description: The top of the 850-year-old Kutubiyya mosque looks precarious after a 6.8 magnitude earthquake hit Marrakesh

item.title: Piles of rubble left in street after deadly Morocco quake
item.description: The 6.8 magnitude earthquake hit central Morocco, killing at least 296 people, the country's interior ministry says.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: The lunchbox is back after the summer holidays so here are some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.

item.title: Five tips for saving petrol money examined
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: What is happening to house prices, and could there be a crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: How to deal with a rent rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Hacks to help save money on your food shop
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled or delayed?
item.description: Technical glitches have caused disruption at airports but passengers do have rights.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.

item.title: Six tips for getting a job if you're over 50
item.description: Recruiters and charities give their advice for anyone wanting to get back into work.
